title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists

content.rendered:
What are Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists?

Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists analyze and report on a client’s credit information. They advise their clients on the risk of extending their credit to help their clients make safe, smart financial decisions.

Where do Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists work?

  • Banking companies
  • Insurance companies

How much do Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists is $60,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Business majors
  • Economics majors
Search relevant jobs

Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists succeed in their work:

  • Communication skills–oral and written
  • Attention to detail
  • Knowledge of math and statistics

What are some common questions about Credit and Financial Risk Managers and Specialists?

Q: What’s it like to be a credit and financial risk intern?

A: Check out real student intern experiences here!
